dogecoin.text:
@Dogecoin_Wins The most common reason fools claim blockchain helps with is publishing a log of official data.

In reality this can be done extremely well with a solution like Wikipedia or Git, with each edit digitally signed, and a bunch of interested unaffiliated people & orgs hosting mirrors.
@Dogecoin_Wins (Trusting someone can just mean trusting their incentives given their {company, reputation, law enforcement})

@Dogecoin_Wins Blockchain has zero use case compared to other technologies, besides Bitcoin being a stable gold-like game theoretic equilibrium of storing value under an unknown range of background conditions.

You just can’t get anything done without a trusted party or two somewhere.
@Dogecoin_Wins @DOGE Ahh ok I thought it was official, was wondering what was up with the "_eth". Thanks
@Dogecoin_Wins Lol if Musk signs off on this it’ll be so fucking pathetic. He really should know better.
@Dogecoin_Wins @ChrisJBakke And it's just a lower bound on AI…

@elonmusk I bought Dogecoin because I thought Elon tweeting this stuff would move the price *up*.

It’s not working anymore, gotta step it up @elonmusk. Let’s put it on the side of Starship.
@Dogecoin_Wins @lieon @tjstebbing I made this for that situation - https://t.co/NLd5Qpv2rK
